alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 24 at 9:44PM CDT until October 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .A nearly stationary line of thunderstorms produced 3 to locally 5 inches of rain across the Black River basin Tuesday evening. Rainfall will slow down tonight, with a break for most of the day Wednesday. Another round of heavy rain is expected Wednesday night through Thursday, with another 1 to 2 inches possible. There is a chance for Major Level Flooding for the Black River if higher end precipitation amounts occur Wednesday night. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 39.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 43.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 52.5 feet Thursday morning. It will rise to 54.0 feet Friday morning before falling below flood stage this weekend. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 55.6 feet on 06/27/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
